comments.commentBody:
Best comment here, thanks Perry-Lynn.

I remember reading a magazine piece on Lee Radziwill from about that time. Her sister had eclipsed her in fame and fortune, and poor Lee was spending some time at some retreat in the Mediterranean. She spent that summer plucking her leg hairs.

People are funny.

You need to listen to Pacifica Radio's guests on Ian Master's 'Background Briefing.' Then you might realize how stupid your questions and statements are. Putin is in trouble in his own country and under extreme pressure like despots in history before him to distract and make a big show for a people whose lives he is utterly incompetent to make better. Hitler comes to mind. Plus, he is possessed of delusions of regaining the lost power of an empire, and, what the world should truly fear, some sense of glory. Napoleon Bonaparte comes to mind.

Look at recent pictures of him in public after meetings: at the U.N. and outside the Russian legislature. He is deeply troubled. One expert stated that Putin has no choice in his own mind but to do everything he can to remain in power. His crimes against the Russian people are of such a nature and magnitude that his only safety anywhere in the world is in Russia and in power. He is therefore, a very dangerous man who possesses nuclear weapons.

This needs to be entered into any calculations of how to deal with him.

He is not at all a stupid man. He is a bad man.
I can figure it out, but the directions seem to be out of order.

She is the first Presidental Candidate to talk about Child Care and Women's Health Care.
That in itself is remarkable in this world run by men.

Name one real achievement that HRC has done on her own? She was First Lady because she married Bill. She stuck by him while he humiliated her with Monica fiasco. Would she have been a serious senate candidate if not for being First Lady? She got defeated in the '08 primary by a newbie from Illinois. As Sec of State she did a 'reset' with Russia. How did that turn out? What accomplishments did she do in that job?

In response to Joe of Iowa:

You state: "Good to know there are voters out there that vote solely on what is between the candidates legs."

Considering that there have been 44 male Presidents, I can see what stimulates you enough to get up and vote.

Democrats and Republicans who have disgust for their parties have more in common with issues then they probably realize. Yes you hear the extremes from both sides because they yell the loudest and get the most media coverage. The vast majority though want the best for each other and our country.

I only hope we can find that way forward together before the country rips itself apart.

You may not agree with Bernie but you could hardly call him a sell out or lacking integrity. He has fought hard for the same issues for 30 years. He doesn't take super-pac money, which means he is beholden to no one.
Having voted for the Bush/Cheney war in Iraq, I think Hillary's record on human rights has been sullied just a tad.

One can make a good case that Bill Clinton did more harm than did Ronald Reagan.  He accomplished things that a Republican could not in support of neoliberalism.  It was Clinton who deregulated the banks; Reagan would have loved to have done so, but couldn't.  It's imperative that we back another Clinton?  No thanks.

A vote for Mrs. Clinton elects Wall St. Billionaires, International Corporations and Elite One% Families . She doesn't report or answer to the Salvation Army . A vote for Senator Sanders - is - a vote for Senator Sanders - you - me - and our families . Bernie wants us to once again enjoy Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of Happiness, the American Way . All we have to do is, as he has said in  every speech, support him totally . With Bernie, his 12 point program and the Presidents Bully Pulpit, supported by millions of American voters he can/will get the job done . To motivate Congress REelection must be threatened by taking away their $$$$$ or their voters .

One good reason is her cynical, awful vote for Bush's Iraq War.

The chance that she took that vote for any other reason besides crass political positioning—to be seen as "tough"—is nonexistent.

There are other reasons but you only asked for one.

The money printing approach, while birthed also in a belief in the necessity to flood the banks with money, mainly hoped to avoid a discontented public. Which is one of the reasons they flooded the banks. A discontent, that an alternative-austerity was feared to surely bring.

Oops! It looks like the people may see the big picture. Does this mean as long as we're discontented anyway, we are ready to face reality and endure a few, possibly several decades of prudent austerity?
No, they both represent the discontented right- and left-wing members of their respective parties. Opposite side of the political spectrum maybe, but the comparison is entirely apt.
This whole "neocon warmonger" thingy is based on what exactly? A whole new standard invented for HRC all by herself? Is she proposing any actual wars?
He is a less-smart, more grumpy version of Trump.

Crazy implies incoherence and irrationality. You don't see that in Sanders, unless, of course, if you think it is crazy to demand economic equality.

Simply asserting that Trump=Sanders because they are not in an establishment party is, at best, a lazy argument.
Be careful, people loved Gump for his simplicity and honesty.
Sanders the socialist and wealth re-distributor is essentially the Trump of the left.  Crazy, just on the opposite side.

What is wrong is not the inference but the assumptions underpinning it. Ie overuse of Ceteris Paribus on a complex economic reality. Never before they had emerged threats such as those of this century. Erosion due arising from climate change; technology that tends to suppress employment; overpopulation in the outlying areas; the excessive monetarism on the real economy; the concentration of wealth, and the existing deregulation inappropriate at this same time of threats; etc. All of which makes the usual economic theories of the past may not work properly today. The above scenario may position the threat of recession on the horizon and to make decadent aggregate demand. It is a difficult situation and that solution may have a new challenge by man; perhaps something like the goal of seeking out economic exploitation of the planet may seem a pipe dream, but it sure is a hope that relieves.

"It is the banking industry, you stupid!" is the very clear statement. Who cares about Peter who? I hate long condescending explanation by Gourevitch because it is boring. Your explanation with empirical evidence that profit margin of the banking industry has been shrinking is very clear circumstantial evidence since nobody has taped the critical moment between someone at Fed and influential bankers. We can't always expect miracle video of Romney, the 47% guy.

Made the recipe exactly as written except for two changes -- I added a bit more salt, and I took SDCook's advice and did the extended roast at 250°.  It came out divine.  And the pan drippings made an outstanding gravy.

The public is waking up to the stale rhetoric of what was once the permanent political class and Hillary's response to the scandals were the alarm which triggered the wake-up.
She has done a service in demonstrating who we don't want in office.
With her near 89% burn rate this is the take-away.

Senator Sanders is a Democratic Socialist Of the People, By the People and For the People . Just like Republican Presidents Abraham Lincoln and "Teddy" Roosevelt and his cousin Democratic President Franklin Delano Roosevelt (FDR) . Those three Presidents made America what it used to be and what Bernie Sanders wants us to return to .

Minnie Mouse might be a better female candidate than HRC.

At least Minnie would have made it on her own and not by being married to WJC.

lamplighter:

No, it's clear that Dems only want non-serious-executives of ANY kind to presume to the presidency. The only one who is calls himself the Gov. of Maryland, and he has about as much chance as Lindsey Graham on the other side. Bernie, of course, was a mayor for awhile, and Hillary would claim a co-presidency, but if that were serious she would have been in the Oval Office with Monica and the blue dress. She was also U.S. Sec. of State and presided over the unwinding of the entire world and the Benghazi mess.

So you guys continue emphasizing fantasist legislators and Machiavellian triangulators who don't actually DO anything. We'll see how far you get.

I disagree ! Mr. Trump is a totally qualified, acceptable passenger for your Clown Car . He is just a bit more vocal and vociferous  than the other passengers but his pronouncements are certainly compatible .
Took your advice about the lower temperature.  And it came out amazing.  Thanks for the suggestion!
